title: Authentic Bosnian Experience
text: Down the street from my daughter's home is a piece of Eastern Europe! Each and every day the Bosnian locals gather to enjoy their coffee or drinks. I had passed it so many times and finally ventured in for a Bosnian coffee and pastry. I was welcomed but found they served only Italian coffee but no pastries. It was delicious! Enjoyed visiting with the bartender and meeting the locals who sat outside daily even if I was looked at a bit sceptically. I try to make a stop each visit, and they always remember me.

title: Quick Breakfast for Pickup
text: Decided to order takeout to enjoy breakfast outside with my Dad at Bethany Homes. Always satisfying but I wouldn’t say amazing because it was 10+ minutes until we were able to eat it. But, my Dad was happy!

title: Regular When I Visit
text: My daughter introduced me to this place when my grandson was born. Delicious pho and always ready for pick up when I arrived! Even my son-in-law who’s very picky loves the food.

title: Send Off Treat
text: Had always noticed this donut shop as I headed for home and am not big on donuts, but when I saw so many people stopping I decided I could use a bit of a sugar lift for the road. Delicious! No wonder the locals stopped!

title: Quick Order
text: I was hungry after my Covid test so ordered by phone telling them I’d be there in 10 minutes. I was impressed as I was there in 5, and they were waiting. Always good!

title: Evening Stop
text: Was coming home from hospital after my grandson was born looking for an evening meal. It was so early in the Covid pandemic, I was still paranoid about being inside. Ordered and sat outside. The service was wonderful and I took my meal home to eat. Would love to return when I’m back in St. Louis.

title: Alternative to Fast food
text: We were tired of fast food as we worked on rehabbing my house so this was a nice alternative. Food was good and consistent.

title: Anniversary Dinner
text: Was excited to go out for our first meal since Covid began and were happy to be able to sit outside. But for a New Orleans style restaurant found out meals average and not particularly tasty even my dessert. No hurry to return.

title: Visited A Dedicated Tree
text: A man from my hometown dedicated a tree in my father’s honor at this lovely site by the river. We weren’t even aware of this place had he not done so as we stay in Naples and only fly into Ft. Myers. Because we were limited on time, a staff member met us at the ticket office and provided us complimentary tickets so we could see the lovely African Tulip Tree and marker he had selected. What a wonderful way to remember my Dad nearly 2000 miles from his hometown. When we saw how beautiful the gardens were and how well maintained the homes of Edison and Ford were, we decided to skip visiting friends and take this wonderful opportunity to enjoy the grounds. I knew so little about these 2 amazing men and enjoyed soaking in the lovely setting.

title: Dinner After A Ride On The Boat
text: My stepdaughter ordered two large pizzas and a Greek salad after our ride in their boat at sunset. The veggie pizza was delicious and I really like the crust and especially the compliment of salad. No wonder they order it so often!

title: Not An Easy Quick Stop
text: So I was hoping to find Victoria Secret and Columbia outlet stores for a couple additions to my vacation wardrobe. Was happy to at least find Columbia but I had to walk forever to find it. If I were in the shopping mood I might have enjoyed it more. Did find what I need. Was only annoyed with the number of vendors offering hand cream samples.
place: Miromar Outlets between Naples & Fort Myers

title: Lovely Lunch
text: Was only intending to make a quick stop at the mall but we were hungrier than excepted. We enjoyed the outdoor seating and selecting flatbread seemed an obvious choice. We could have split even a small, but my husband inhaled his Mediterranean and I took 1/3 of my Spineriti to go. Really packed on the veggies!!

title: Lunch After Our Flight
text: Love their muffulettas and my husband picked the roast turkey. Split a quarter with my husband and it was just enough with chips.

title: Gastropub Gift
text: My daughter bought us a gift card for this restaurant and it was my first venture out even for curbside pick up after the pandemic began. Especially enjoyed The Perfect Storm! Service was great!

title: Great Suggestion
text: My sister and I weren’t feeling like fast food for lunch so was glad she suggested trying this pre-made pizza to bake at my cousin’s home. It was very good and three pieces it the spot.

title: So Glad It’s Open
text: Not a lot of choices and wouldn’t have been my first choice but my toasted spicy Italian sub hit the spot! Not sure why I didn’t stop my first wander thru the Food Stall. I wasn’t disappointed!

title: Lukewarm Lunch
text: Don’t normally stop at fast food restaurants but not many choices in southern Indiana and I was too hungry to wait until Louisville. Our burgers and fries were lukewarm, and my husband specifically said what he wanted on his and still got cheese. The pickles were good! Will tide us over until we get home.

title: Craving Mexican But Disappointed
text: Because of COVID, my employer gave us all funds to pick up a meal for a Zoom luncheon. I was craving Mexican and had never tried Patron so ordered a lunch for pick up. I love Chile Relleno but found it and the beans and rice was not as flavorful as I had hoped. Not in any hurry to return.

title: Fundraiser Attracted Me
text: A fundraiser for a local non-profit had me down in the Clifton area picking up a pizza for my husband and me. I had never had Dewey's and know why they get such great reviews. The crust was excellent and overall a wonderful tasting pizza.

title: Wedding Dress Shopping Brunch
text: My daughter selected this dinner to meet her future mother in law, bridesmaid and myself before shopping on Reading's wedding dress row. We enjoyed the breakfast specials and coffee before making our way down the street. Friendly service and reasonably priced but unfortunately it wasn't a place that made the bride to be feel special as one of the other restaurants had for my other daughter a month earlier.

title: A Bit Disappointing
text: I always set my expectations high when I find a German restaurant. My daughter and I found ourselves in this small town when she was coaching at a gymnastics meet at French Lick. We tried the Kraut Balls and had the German specials for our main meals, but didn't find anything to rave about for the price. Instead, it was what I would expect for dinner out in the middle of nowhere. Friendly servers but average meat and potatos.

title: Disappointing
text: It sounded like such an interesting restaurant but personally I found it rather tasteless. My daughter and I stopped in after getting our hair cuts and were excited to try something new. I wouldn't return.
place: Roll On In Sushi Burritos & Bowls

title: Drinks After Dinner
text: We don't often come down to OTR but had a gift certificate we used for dinner on Valentine's Day. Since we ate so early, we wandered across the street and decided to enjoy a glass of wine in this lovely spot before heading home. The intimate setting was pleasant and we enjoyed the chance to sample wines we wouldn't normally enjoy.

title: Valentine's Day at the Senate
text: My husband and I used our gift certificate to spend Valentine's Day in OTR. A co-worker recommended the Senate and we got there early on a Friday night. We loved the atmosphere and I enjoyed the mussels while my husband enjoyed their specialty, a hot dog.

title: Lunch While On Break
text: My daughter and I found this restaurant not too far from the Fair Grounds between sessions at a gymnastic meet. The servers were very helpful especially when we requested to be moved out to the patio so as not to disturb the other guests as my 15-month-old grandson misbehaved. My fish tacos were very good and everyone enjoyed their lunch.

title: History Combined With Lovely Trails
text: The Milford area is so fortunate that this non-profit organization was formed to preserve this farmland for hiking and gardening by locals as well as later purchasing the Gatch farm house and buildings. I enjoyed a breakfast meeting in this beautiful house and have attended their fundraisers as well as their Halloween trail ride. Because this is free, I kick myself for not visiting it more often for night hikes sponsored by the organization and day hikes for the fresh air, exercise and to enjoy the beautiful of the this woodland near the East Fork River.

title: Quick Coffee Before Flying
text: I had hoped for a name brand coffee and to grab a bit, but nothing looked appealing so just settled for a coffee. Better than nothing but just average.

title: Welcoming Congregation
text: At a regular church goer, I was glad we were able to join my father and sisters for this church service. It is a beautiful church and offers various services for attending depending on their worship preferences. I especially enjoyed this weekend as the children had their Christmas presentation. For anyone wanting to attend church while visiting Fargo, I would recommend this congregation.

title: Some Sunshine Before Conference
text: Met at this spot for a morning drink before a church conference. Nice sunny spot on a crisp autumn morning to enjoy my orange juice. Most popular spot for miles!!

title: Quick Lunch
text: It was about the only place that was convenient working in Lower Price Hill and quick. Typical comfort food. No complaints.

title: Convenient Location
text: We needed a caffeine stop on our way home so was glad we could quickly get off the interstate and grab a pick up.

title: My Daughter’s Favorite!
text: My daughter insisted we visit the Old Mill for brunch. We got there early enough to beat much of the holiday weekend crowd. The food was delicious and the server patient even when my grandson wasn’t particularly cooperative.

title: First Date with Grandson
text: Picked this restaurant for its review to take my 14 month old grandson while his mother coached a gymnastics meet downtown. Wonderful and understanding service given this entertaining 2 year old was dropping food on the floor. My sandwich was delicious and I would recommend returning when I visit Knoxville again.

title: Winter Visit
text: Needed an activity for my grandson while his mother coached at a local gymnastics meet. Conveniently located off the highway. Lot of construction going on as it was winter and only the gift shop open, but for a small zoo it was the perfect size to fill our time on a dry cold winter day. A few animals to see especially in the children’s zoo. Quite a few inside. Discount price was right.

title: Very Nice Gymnastics Venue
text: Went with my gymnastic coach daughter to a meet to watch my grandson. Ample parking and easy to get to for out of towners. Good size, clean restrooms with nice size space for venues. Would recommend for anyone attending an event here!

title: Just the Two of Us
text: Have had a gift card for a while so made our way to Anderson Township for a night out. Enjoy the food and atmosphere more than the other Italian chain. Nice evening out!!

title: Annual New Year’s Day Hike
text: Finally convinced my husband to join his sister whose very involved in the maintenance and expansion of the trail. Beautiful place to enjoy a walk, hike and the history of the area. Beautifully maintained and lovely! Wish it weren’t so far from home!!

title: Filled the Need
text: I was hungry but still calorie conscious so decided on the grilled combo. The sauce was tasty and meat juicy but could have had a bit more grilled taste. Did think an additional$.50 for the peach all-natural lemonade was worth it but should have said light on the ice.

title: After Church Stop
text: Always love having Caribou coffee while I'm up in Fargo. We stopped after church and I enjoyed my caffeine hit at this convenient location.

title: Glad My Sister Recommended
text: Great spot to pick up a variety of breads and has an extensive menu that varies from day to day. My sister and I stopped for a loaf for sandwiches and enjoyed a sweet treat as well.

title: Always A Good Selection
text: Always enjoy the selection at this theater and the variety of theater sizes even though I am closer to other theaters. Great parking on both sides and often in and out faster in the back.

title: Great Lunch Option
text: My stepson introduced us to the sandwiches at lunch while we were in town before the holidays. Would definitely return on another visit.

title: Fun Experience
text: My stepson is always looking for a new place in Chicago to introduce us to. We didn’t eat as we had dinner plans but enjoyed buying treats for the grandkids in the grocery store.

title: Hit the Spot
text: With so few choices, I was glad to see BK open. Wanted a salad but so I didn’t starve on the flight my husband and I split an expensive fish burger. It hit the spot as did the small fries but I was disappointed they didn’t have onion rings. Customer service was excellent!!

title: Best Part of Trip!!
text: We are so lucky to have family in Naples with a boat now as we could otherwise not have enjoyed the beautiful beach, warm September water nearing sunset. It’s full of live sand dollars to see snorkeling and those no longer alive to take home. Our first spot we stopped on Friday there was only one resident visible otherwise we had the whole beach to ourselves! Plan to visit again today.

title: Convenient Stop
text: Was grateful for this easily accessible coffee stop. Much easier than getting off at Grove City when I need a caffeine hit.

title: Great Experience
text: I always challenge my stepson to give us a great experience when we visit Chicago. He met the challenge! His friend joined us who selected our food choices and we loved everything offered! Authentic experience!

title: Not the Fun Place I Remember
text: We used to frequent this restaurant 15 years ago, but it’s novelty has warn off. My small group decided to meet here for a holiday dinner. The food was good but not exceptional. Lots more places I’d like to try.

title: Not What It Used To Be
text: I grew up near Fargo, but it’s not what it used to be. What mall is! I was able to get what I needed but not a place I’d spend much time unless I had to.

title: Great Location for Lincoln Park Wedding
text: This hotel was in a perfect location for a Lincoln Park wedding. The rooms are certainly clean, but nothing special. At first I was disappointed that we faced the alley but the members in our party who faced the street complained of the street noise. I wish they had put a bigger warning that a bottle of Fiji water was $5 and we had a refrigerator. The other exterior rooms were much larger and did include refrigerators. I’d stay again though for the price and location.
place: Hotel Versey Days Inn by Wyndham Chicago

title: Takeout Before Covid
text: We ordered steaks to eat with my Dad at his retirement community rather than take him out. Definitely not the same as eating in as we had to reheat it. Not my first choice for a steak but Dad was happy.

title: Love Celebrating Here!
text: Second visit in a couple years to catch up with old friends while I was in town. Excellent meal and service!

title: Short Chicago Stopover
text: During an unexpected layover in Chicago, my stepson parked me at the bar while he exercised and I had a quick dinner and drink before heading to the airport. Nice meal, tastefully presented.

title: Finally!!
text: I finally made it! I had been bugging my husband for months for ice cream at Aglamesis even though we only live a couple miles away. It’s delicious - no need for any toppings!!

title: After School Treat
text: Stopped for cones after picking the grandkids up after school. A treat for both them and me. Don’t like the cones, rather tasteless, but the vanilla ice cream is as great is it was when I was a kid.

title: Afternoon Pick Up
text: Quick stop to wake me up at this convenient location. Server mixed up my size and I ended up with a medium Macchiato and my stepdaughter a small. I was grateful.

title: Quick Snack After a Snackless Flight
text: We made a quick stop after arriving in Ft. Meyer and heading for Naples. Enjoyed the lemonade and shared a chicken strip and waffle fry dinner with my husband. Did the trick! Moist chicken is the best!

title: Experiencing Norwegian Culture
text: For years my father has been buying lefse from Carl's, but I had never visited to see how this bakery makes the quantities it supplies to the area especially during the holiday season. Lefse, the Norwegian excuse for putting butter and sugar together, was a treat made by my grandmother and mother growing up. So every year when we make the trip to the Fargo-Moorhead area we know where to track down lefse to bring home to Ohio. Worth a visit to pick up some for a taste of Norway!
